item.title: Grounded 2: How to Get Flower Petals
item.description:
With the arrival of Obsidian Entertainment's Grounded 2 beta kicking off in July 2025, players have many new biomes to explore, bugs to battle for survival, resources to collect, and story quests to complete. Players will need to scavenge for materials and work their way through weapon and armor improvements to keep progressing through each area and quest, which makes knowing where to find key resources highly important.

Among the many useful resources that players will be able to acquire during their playthrough, Flower Petals are a versatile material used in different crafting recipes. This makes them a brilliant item worth picking up, but they can be quite tricky to locate if you do not know where to search. If you're looking for where to find Flower Petals in Grounded 2 , all relevant information has been outlined in the guide below.

How to Get Flower Petals in Grounded 2

In Grounded 2 , Flower Petals can be harvested from Hosta Plants by attacking them with your weapon. There are a couple of different locations in which Hosta Plants can be located; however, one of these locations is very much linked to the end-game. For this reason, it's better to focus on acquiring them from the other location, as this can be reached relatively early on.

Several Hosta Plants can be discovered on/near the Picnic Table and surrounding areas. This is quite handy, as you can do a run to the general area and hit all approximate Hosta Plant locations to farm multiple Flower Petals at once. Some of them will require you to climb up the Picnic Table to acquire them, though, so players should be prepared to face a few threats along the way and keep their eyes out for other valuable resources, too.

All approximate Picnic Table Hosta Plant locations have been marked on the map below with a red X.

Other Hosta Plants can be discovered later on in the Statue location as players work their way through the Networking main story quest. Flower Petals come in handy for crafting many different items, meaning they're worth grabbing both earlier on at the Picnic Table as well as later on. One such crafting example involving Flower Petals involves the Ladybug Armor pieces, which will help improve your survivability during exploration.

item.title: How to Get the Major Lazer Skin in Fortnite (2025)
item.description:
Major Lazer is one of the rarest skins in Fortnite . It had not been seen in the Item Shop for over four years, and before its last appearance, over a year had passed since it was previously made available. While Major Lazer was purchasable for a few days in a row most of the times that it was displayed in the Item Shop, it was only available in Fortnite a total of 13 times, so fans have not had many chances to purchase it since its first release.

This guide will tell players what they need to know about the Major Lazer skin, which was added as part of the Fortnite Icon Series. It will only be in the shop for a few days, so this guide has summed up all of the information about it so gamers can decide if they should buy it or not.

When Was the Major Lazer Skin Last Seen in Fortnite?

  • June 13, 2021

The Major Lazer skin and its set were first released in Fortnite back in August 2019, during Chapter 1 Season X. In 2020, the skin made one appearance in the Item Shop in March, and then it disappeared until the following year. Players could find this cosmetic set in the Item Shop in April and June 2021, but that was the last time it was ever made available before 2025.

Major Lazer has not been available for purchase in Fortnite since June 13, 2021 - over four years ago . Players have another chance to catch this skin, but it may become unavailable for a long time once again. Therefore, gamers who have been eying Major Lazer since it made its last appearance should consider getting it now. Below, they can find information on how much it costs and how long it'll be around this time.

How to Get the Major Lazer Skin in Fortnite (2025)

The Major Lazer skin is available in the Fortnite Item Shop until August 6, 2025 . The skin costs 1,600 V-Bucks, and it includes the Lazer Wings back bling and the Lazer Flex built-in emote. However, players who want to own the entire Lazerism set, which includes the Lazer Axe pickaxe and the Lazer Blast emote, can purchase the Major Lazer bundle for 2,400 V-Bucks, and the following items will be added to their in-game locker:

  • Major Lazer skin
  • Lazer Flex emote (built-in)
  • Lazer Wings back bling
  • Lazer Axe pickaxe
  • Lazer Blast emote

Separately, the Lazer Blast emote costs 500 V-Bucks and the Lazer Axe pickaxe costs 800 V-Bucks. Therefore, players who want the entire set can save 800 V-Bucks if they purchase the bundle. Below, players can find a showcase of the Lazerism set:

item.title: Ubisoft Reportedly Threatened to Sue Assassin's Creed 4 Edward Kenway Actor
item.description:
Matt Ryan, the actor who portrayed Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag protagonist Edward Kenway, seems to have gotten into legal trouble with Ubisoft. The voice actor has indicated that some past behavior apparently got him in hot water, leading to a threat of a lawsuit from Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag developer Ubisoft.

Video game developers and publishers being litigious is nothing new, but it's fairly rare to hear about lawsuits being aimed at their own performers. However, those involved with a game's development have to take care to not violate any non-disclosure agreements they may have signed.

From the sound of it, that may be what happened here. In a recent video at an autograph signing, a fan asks Matt Ryan whether an Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag remaster is coming out. Ryan initially simply responded that he didn't know, but the fan continued asking, bringing up a prior video where Ryan had seemingly teased the possibility of a remaster being in the works. Ryan looks notably embarrassed at that point, and explains that he didn't know he was being recorded when that exchange occurred, and was being "free and open" with the fan. Before he goes back to signing autographs, he notes that "the company" threatened to sue him, presumably referring to Ubisoft, and reiterates, "I say nothing."

Edward Kenway Voice Actor's Prior Statement

In the aforementioned video clip, which broke in late June 2025, Ryan was signing an autograph for another fan, and asked them if they had finished playing Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag . The fan said they had, to which Ryan responded that they might need to beat it again, with a sort of coy expression on his face. He went on to add that there was a reason for him saying that, but that he couldn't say anything further on the matter. It seems that the moment was meant as a little teaser exclusively for the fan, who, unfortunately for Ryan, shared the hint that a Black Flag remaster was finally happening with the world.

Though he technically didn't confirm anything one way or another, it seems that Ubisoft may have found the clip to be infringing enough to issue a legal threat to him. Presuming that an Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag remaster is actually in the works, Ryan has likely had to sign an NDA regarding his involvement and the development of it. As a result, hopeful Assassin's Creed fans shouldn't expect to hear anything else from Ryan on the matter until if and when such a time that the remaster is actually announced by official sources.

item.title: September 18 is Going to Be a Big Day for Hello Kitty Island Adventure
item.description:
Hello Kitty Island Adventure is adding a wealth of new content to the game on September 18 as part of its first official expansion, Wheatflour Wonderland. The upcoming additions to Hello Kitty Island Adventure were revealed as part of the latest Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase, which featured a variety of announcement trailers for new game and content releases.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure initially released as an Apple Arcade exclusive back in 2023 before later being ported to PC and Nintendo Switch earlier this year on January 30. Several updates have come out following the games release, including the noteworthy 2024 update to Hello Kitty Island Adventure that added a new City Town region, new character Usahana, and the Imagination Cafe.

The first-ever DLC for Hello Kitty Island Adventure , Wheatflour Wonderland, was announced by developer Sunblink during the Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase on July 31. The DLC has been given a September 18 release date for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, and PC via Steam at a price point of $14.99, with the expansion available for free to Apple Arcade subscribers. In addition to the Wheatflour Wonderland announcement, Sunblink confirmed Hello Kitty Island Adventure is being ported to PlayStation 5 on August 5.

New Content Coming to Hello Kitty Island Adventure

As shared by Sunblink, the Wheatflour Wonderland DLC will add the largest new world since the games launch. The expansion will also introduce a new befriendable Sanrio character, Cogimyun, wholl offer an unprecedented 35 levels of friendship that grant new quests, abilities, and an exclusive furniture set. Players will also be able to meet Ebi Fry and Cogimyuns brother, Cogimyon, who'll unlock new mini-games with various prize offerings, including themed furniture. Adding a little extra magic to the game, players will be able to create and customize magic wands that can be used to transform into critters and items and access new puzzles and challenges.

New outfits and accessories are being added as well that can be used to transform into the Wheatflour Guardians of legend," along with 100 discoverable Wheathearts that can be exchanged at the Wheatheart Tree for themed rewards, plus new craftable noodle-based foods once players find the Noodle Grass collectible. Overall, Wheatflour Wonderland serves as the games most substantial content expansion to date with more stuff on offer than was included with the recent City Classics update for Hello Kitty Island Adventure .

While the $14.99 price point for Wheatflour Wonderland may seem steep for some players, the scope of content appears to justify the cost for dedicated fans of the series. Wheatflour Wonderland is even more expansive than other themed updates, including the Under the Sea Celebration for Hello Kitty Island Adventure that released back in May with collectible Mermaid Scales that players could exchange for ocean-themed outfits. While the Wheatflour Wonderland expansion may be the first, it likely wont be the last DLC release for Hello Kitty Island Adventure .

item.title: Umamusume Pretty Derby Giving Out Special Reward for Major Milestone
item.description:
Umamusume Pretty Derby is giving out a plethora of special rewards to celebrate the game's Discord server hitting a major milestone. The mobile game centered around anthropomorphized race horses has been a smash hit since the global version of the game launched last month, quickly surging to the top of both the mobile and Steam charts. Umamusume Pretty Derby even caught on with content creators following its release, with popular YouTuber Ludwig hosting a streamer tournament for the game. Now, Umamusume is celebrating another major milestone for one of its social media platforms.

Umamusume Pretty Derby 's early success has been sustained across each version of the game's global release. Umamusume 's Steam version saw impressive numbers following its launch, peaking at just over 87,000 users and even eclipsing the global launch of Persona 5: The Phantom X . One of the game's most recent gacha banners has also seen plenty of excitement, with the SSR Kitasan Black Support card commonly seen as one of the game's strongest Supports. Umamusume fans now have even more to celebrate with some exciting rewards on the way.

Umamusume: Pretty Derby has officially rolled out some brand-new rewards to commemorate a new milestone for the game. Developer Cygames revealed that the game's official Discord server has surpassed 150,000 members, with Umamusume giving out 50,000 Monies, 50,000 Support Points, and 10 Alarm Clocks to celebrate the achievement. The rewards also follow the recent addition of the game's newest gacha banners, introducing a new 3-star Trainee in Curren Chan and an SSR Support card for Yukino Bijin. Cygames previously gave out a similar set of rewards to celebrate the game's Twitter account passing 150,000 followers.

Umamusume Celebrates Discord Milestone with Special Rewards

  • Monies x50,000
  • Support Points x50,000
  • Alarm Clock x10

Umamusume 's special rewards look to provide some very useful resources for players to utilize. Monies and Support Points are essential for fans to level up their Trainees and Support cards, boosting the character's stats and providing access to special bonuses and skills. Alarm Clocks are helpful in the game's Career mode, allowing players to retry races where the player failed to meet their goal. Umamusume has also regularly given out Carats for the game's gacha system, granting even more chances to pick up the game's newest characters.

The early success of Umamusume: Pretty Derby comes as the game has continued to provide plenty more content for fans. Cygames has introduced several special events throughout recent weeks, ranging from Legend Races letting players easily rack up Star Pieces to the "Spring G1 Celebration Missions" rewarding players for clearing specific races. Umamusume has also featured an "accelerated" banner schedule, adding new characters to the game nearly weekly. Umamusume: Pretty Derby should be poised to continue its early momentum with lots more on the way from the mobile game.
